snippet: The Metropolitan Museum of Art has acquired an ancient Roman urn and a group of 44 20th-century glass works by Carlo Scarpa.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column describes recent acquisitions by Metropolitan Museum of Art and Getty Research Institute in Los Angeles as well as interactive installations at Brooklyn's MetroTech Center; notes additions to curatorial staffs at Metropolitan Museum of Art and National Gallery of Art in Washington, DC.
lead_paragraph: The Metropolitan Museum of Art has acquired an ancient Roman urn and a group of 44 20th-century glass works by Carlo Scarpa.

headline.main: Form, Function and Beauty Span Eons in Met Acquisitions
headline.print_headline: Form, Function and Beauty Span Eons in Met Acquisitions
